content:
きづかう〔気遣う〕
〈他動〉To be anxious (about a matter―for one's welfare); to be concerned (about a matter―for one's welfare); to be solicitous (about a matter―for one's welfare); to have misgivings (about a matter); to make oneself uneasy (about a matter); to fear, be afraid of (failure); to apprehend, be apprehensive of, have apprehensions of (failure); to fear for (one's safety); to be apprehensive for (one's safety); to be alarmed

content.content: 彼は試験の成績を気づかっている
He is anxious about the result of his examination―He has misgivings about the result of his examination.
失敗を気づかっている(失敗しやせぬかと気づかっている)
He fears lest he should fail―He is afraid of failure―He is apprehensive of failure.
日本人は間違ったことを言うのを気づかって英語を使わない
Japanese students do not speak English, for they are afraid of making mistakes―Japanese students do not speak English for fear of making mistakes.
お母さんは君の身の上を気づかっておられる
Your mother is anxious for your welfare―concerned for your welfare―solicitous for your welfare.
お母さんは君の安危を気づかっておられる
Your mother fears for your safety―She is apprehensive for your safety.
(彼は死にはせぬかと)万一を気づかっている
I fear for his life―tremble for his life.
彼は発狂したのじゃないかと気づかっている
I fear for his reason.
気づかうほどの病気じゃない
He is not so ill as to cause apprehensions―His illness is not such as to cause apprehensions―His illness is not of a nature to cause apprehensions.
なにも気づかうことは無い
There is no need of anxiety―There is no cause for anxiety―There is no cause for anxiety―There is no cause for alarm―You need not make yourself uneasy.
尽すべきことを尽してさえおいたらなにも気づかうことは無いじゃないか
Is there any cause for anxiety at all if you have done your duty?
彼が病身なので家族は始終気づかっている
His delicate health causes his family constant anxiety.

content:
きっかけ〔切掛け〕
〈名〉
1. (=手始め)A beginning; a start

content.content: これをきっかけに話しを始めた
This started the conversation.
これをきっかけに彼と交際を始めた
This led to our acquaintance.

content: 2. (=機会)an opportunity; a chance

content.content: これが話を切り出す好いきっかけになった
It was a good chance to break the ice.
混雑の起こったのをきっかけにその場を逃げ出した
I took advantage of the confusion―I benefited by the confusion―to effect my escape.

content: 3. (=暗示)a hint

content.content: その言葉をきっかけに彼女を訪ねてみた
Acting on the hint, I called on her.

content:
キッカリ
〈副〉Exactly; punctually

content.content: キッカリ百円になる
It amounts to exactly 100 yen.
キッカリ六時ですよ
It is six sharp.

content:
きづかれ〔気疲れ〕
〈名〉Worry:(=する) to worry oneself (about or over anything)

content.content: 試験で気疲れした
I am worried over my examination.

content:
きづかわしい〔気遣わしい〕
〈叙述形容詞〉(I am) anxious, concerned, solicitous (about the matter―for his welfare); (I) have misgiving (about the matter); (I am) afraid of, apprehensive of (failure); (I) fear for (his safety); (I am) apprehensive for (his safety, etc.)

content.content: 試験の成績が気づかわしい
I am anxious about the result of my examination―I have misgivings about the result of my examination.
失敗が気づかわしい
I am afraid of failure―apprehensive of failure.
成功が気づかわしい
I am anxious for success.
彼の病気が気づかわしい
I am anxious about his illness―concerned about his illness―solicitous about his illness.
彼の全快が気づかわしい
I am anxious for his recovery―concerned for his recovery―solicitous for his recovery.
彼は死にはせぬかと思って気づかわしい
I am afraid of his dying―I am apprehensive of his death―I fear for his life―I tremble for his life.
彼の身の上が気づかわしい
I am anxious for his welfare―concerned for his welfare―solicitous for his welfare.
彼の安危が気づかわしい
I fear for his safety―I am apprehensive for his safety.
母が気づかわしそうに息子を見送っていた
The mother gazed after her son with an anxious air.

content:
きっきょ〔拮据〕
〈名〉Diligence; assiduity; hard work:(=する) to work hard

content.content: 拮据経営ここに二十年
I have worked hard at the business for twenty years.

content:
きっきょう〔吉凶〕
〈名〉Lights and shadows; good or ill luck; fortune

content.content: 吉凶を占う
to tell fortunes―tell one's fortune
吉凶判断
fortune-telling―divination

content:
きっきょう〔喫驚〕
〈名〉Surprise; astonishment; amazement:(=する) to be surprised; to be astonished; to be amazed; to be startled; to be electrified

content.content: 喫驚せしむ
to surprise one―astonish one―amaze one―startle one―electrify one―spring a surprise upon one
新説を唱えて世を喫驚せしむ
to spring a new theory upon the world

content:
きづく〔気付く〕
〈他動〉To notice; to perceive; to remark; to become aware of (a fact)

content.content: あの癖には誰でも気づく
Everybody remarks that peculiarity of his.
彼は僕のいることに気づかなかった
He did not notice my presence.
大勢いたから彼に気づかなかった
I did not perceive him in the crowd.
汽車を乗り違えて一時間たってようやく間違いに気づいた
I took the wrong train by mistake, and it was an hour before I became aware of my mistake.

content:
きっくつ〔佶屈〕
〈形〉Rugged

content.content: 佶屈聱牙{きっくつごうが}の文
a crabbed style

きつけ〔気付け〕
〈名〉An analeptic; a restoration; strong salts

content:
きづけ〔気付け〕
〈名〉Care of (c/o―と略す)

content.content: 上海日本領事館気付け安部太郎殿
Mr. Taro Abe, c/o the Japanese Consulate, Shanghai.

content:
きっこう〔亀甲〕
〈名〉A tortoise-shell

content.content: 亀甲形
a tortoise-shell pattern―a hexagonal pattern

content:
きっこう〔拮抗〕
〈名〉Rivalry; contention:(=する) to rival, contend with, cope with, vie with, compare with (some one in something)

content.content: 学問では彼に拮抗する者は無い
He has no rival in learning―No one can compare with him in scholarship.
彼らは皇室にも拮抗するが如き栄華を極めている
They vie with royalty in splendour.

きっこうがた〔亀甲形〕
〈名〉A tortoise-shell pattern; a hexagonal pattern

content:
きっさき〔切先〕
〈名〉The point of a sword

content.content: 切先鋭く切込んだ
He made a spirited attack with his sword.

きっさてん〔喫茶店〕
〈名〉A tea-room; a tea-booth

content:
きっしょう〔吉祥〕
〈名〉A good omen; a happy augury; a propitious sign

content.content: 天吉祥を示す
Heaven has sent us a happy augury.

content:
ギッシリ
〈副〉Close; tight

content.content: 鞄にギッシリ詰める
to pack a trunk close―pack a trunk tight
鞄はギッシリ詰まっている
The trunk is packed close―packed tight.
紙入れに札がギッシリいっぱい入っている
The purse is chockful of bank-notes―bursting with bank-notes.
一室に人がギッシリ詰まっている
The room is closely packed (with people)―People are packed together in the room.

content:
きっしん〔吉辰〕
〈名〉A lucky day; an auspicious day

content.content: 吉辰を選ぶ
to fix upon a lucky day
吉辰を選んで式を挙げることにする
We shall fix upon a day for the ceremony.
吉辰を選んで式を挙げた
The celebrated the wedding under fair auspices.

content:
きっすい〔吃水〕
〈名〉Draught

content.content: この船は吃水が深い
She draws deep―She has a deep draught.
吃水の深い船
a ship of deep draught―a deep-draught ship
吃水が浅い
She draws light―She has a light draught.
吃水の浅い船
a ship of light draught―a light-draught ship
この船は吃水が何尺あるか
How many feet does she draw?―What does she draw?
戦闘艦は吃水が三十尺近くある
A battleship draws nearly 30 feet of water.
平均吃水
mean draught

content:
きっすい〔生粋〕
〈名〉Pure; genuine; true-born; true-bred

content.content: 生粋の江戸っ子だ
He is a true-born Edokko―a true-bred Edokko―an Edokko born and bred.
生粋の日本人だ
He is a Japanese to the backbone-Japanese of the Japanese.

content:
きっする〔喫する〕
〈他動〉To eat, take (one's meal); to drink, take (tea); to smoke (tobacco)

content.content: 一驚を 喫する
to be surprised―be astonished―be amazed―(at anything)

content:
きっせき〔詰責〕
〈名〉Reproach; reproof; reprimand; rebuke; censure:(=する) to reproach, taunt, twit, upbraid (one with a fault); to reprove, reprimand, censure (one for a fault)

content.content: 男は女の不貞を詰責した
He reproached her with infidelity.
父が子の怠惰を詰責した
The father reproved his son for his idleness.
彼は職務怠慢の故をもって詰責された
He was reprimanded for neglect of duty.

content:
きっそう〔気相〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: けっそう〔血相〕

content:
きっそう〔吉左右〕
〈名〉Good news; a favourable answer

content.content: 吉左右を待つ
I wait for good news―wait for a favourable answer.

きったん〔吉旦〕
〈名〉A lucky day

content:
きっちょう〔吉兆〕
〈名〉A good omen; a lucky sign; a happy augury

content.content: 天吉兆を示す
Heaven has sent us a happy augury.

content:
キッチリ
〈副〉
1. (=数量がちょうど)just enough

content.content: 金はキッチリで余分が無い
The money is just enough―barely sufficient―and leaves no surplus.

content: 2. (=キッチリ何時)punctually; precisely; sharp; to the minute

content.content: キッチリ六時に開会
The meeting opens punctually at six o'clock―at six sharp.
彼はいつもキッチリ八時に来る
He always appears at eight o'clock to the minute.

content: 3. (=キッチリ何時間、何年間)to a minute; to a day

content.content: キッチリ 三時間待った
I waited three hours to a minute.
キッチリ五年かかった
It took five years to a day.

content: 4. (=キッチリ合う)exactly; to a nicety; to a T.

content.content: 君の上衣はキッチリ 合う
Your coat fits you to a nicety―to a T.

content: 5. (=キッチリふたをするなど)tight

content.content: キッチリふたをしておけ
Keep it covered tight.
徳利にキッチリ栓をしておけ
Keep the bottle corked tight.

きつつき〔啄木鳥〕
〈名〉The woodpecker

content:
きって〔切手〕
〈名〉
1. (=郵便切手)a stamp; a postage-stamp

content.content: 手紙に切手をはる
to put a stamp on a letter
この手紙に切手がはっていない
There is no stamp on this letter.
手紙に三銭切手をはって出すのだ
You must post the letter with a three-sen stamp on it.
この手紙はいくらの切手をはればよろしいのですか
What is the postage for this letter?
郵便切手を蒐集する
to collect postage-stamps
郵便切手蒐集
stamp-collecting―philately
切手蒐集家
a stamp-collector―a philatelist
郵便切手代用不苦
payable in stamps
郵便切手代用一割増し
10 percent extra when paid in stamps

content: 2. (=小切手)a cheque

content.content: 切手で支払う
to pay with a cheque

content: 3. (=商品切手)an order

きっての〔切っての〕
〈接尾副詞〉The most...in the whole place

content.content: 彼はかいわいきっての好い男だ
He is the best-looking man in the whole neighbourhood.
省内きっての敏腕家だ
He is the ablest man in the whole department.

content:
きっと〔屹度〕
〈副〉Surely (must); certainly; to a certainty; without fail; honour bright; as sure as a gun; as sure as I am alive; as sure as eggs is eggs

content.content: きっとそうに違いない
Surely it must be so.
彼はきっと成功する
He will certainly succeed―He will succeed to a certainty―He is sure to succeed―He is certain to succeed―He is bound to succeed―I am sure he will succeed―I am sure of his succeeding.
きっと金を返す
I will pay you without fail―I will not fail to pay you.
彼はきっと目的を遂げる
He is sure to accomplish his purpose―He never fails to accomplish his purpose―He never fails of his purpose.
きっとそうだと思う
I am sure of it―I am certain of it.
きっとこうなるだろうと思った
I was sure of this result―I knew how it would be.
病人はきっと治るから安心し給え
You may make yourself easy, for he is sure to recover―he must recover.
君はきっと好い軍人になる
I am sure you will make a good officer.
君はきっと勝つ
I am sure you will―you are sure to win.
これはきっと成功する
I am sure it will succeed―I am sure of its success―It is sure to succeed.
明日はきっと来給え
Be sure to come―Don't fail to come―tomorrow!
きっと忘れ給うな
Be sure not to forget!
きっと来るか
Will you come without fail?―May I count upon you?
きっと来る
I will come without fail―I will not fail to come―You may count upon me.
きっとそうか
Are you sure (of it)?
きっとか
Honour bright?
きっと助力するから安心しろと彼に言え
You may assure him of my assistance.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 僕の言うことはきっと本当だ
You may depend upon the truth of my statement―You may depend upon it.
きっと約束を守るから当てにしてい給え
You may rely upon my promise―You may rely upon me.
この金がきっと先方の手に渡るようにします
I will see that he gets the money.
これからきっとかようなことは致させません
I will see that they do not do so again.
子どもらにきっといたずらをさせません
I will see that the boys get into no mischief.
きっと彼らに金を返させます
I will see that he pays you―I will see that you are paid―I will see you paid.
君のかたきをきっと打たせる
I will see that you are avenged―I will see you avenged.
二人が逢うときっとけんかだ
They never meet without quarrelling.
彼が口を開くときっと下手を言う
He can not open his mouth without putting his foot in it.

content:
きつね〔狐〕
〈名〉
1. The fox:(固有名詞は)Reynard

content.content: 牝狐
a vixen
九尾の狐
the Nine-tailed Fox
狐が美人に化ける
A fox turns itself into a woman.
狐につかれる
to be possessed with a fox
狐つき
one possessed with a fox
狐にばかされる、狐につままれる
to be bewitched by a fox
狐につままれたような気がする
I doubt the evidence of my senses.
一つ穴の狐だ
They are of a hair―of a gang.
虎の威を借る狐
“the ass in the lion's skin.”
狐を馬に乗せたような話
a cock-and-bull story
狐の嫁入り
the witches' sabbath―walpurgis-night
狐の皮
a fox-skin―a fox-case
狐の尾
a fox-brush
狐の穴
a fox-earth
狐を穴へ追いつめる
to run a fox to earth

content: 2. (=女郎)a harlot; a courtesan

きつねがり〔狐狩〕
〈名〉Fox-hunting:(一回なら)a fox-hunt:(=する) to hunt the fox

きつねけん〔狐拳〕
〈名〉A game played with the hands

きつねつき〔狐付き〕
〈名〉One possessed with a fox

きつねび〔狐火〕
〈名〉Will-o'-the-wisp; Jack-o'-lantern; ignis fatuus

content:
キッパリ
〈副〉Positively; definitely; directly; squarely; flatly; point-blank; once for all

content.content: この金は払わぬとキッパリ言った
I positively declared that I would not pay the money.
キッパリ返事をした
I gave definite answer.
そんなことはいやだとキッパリ断った
I positively refused―directly refused―squarely refused―flatly refused―refused point-blank―to be so.
そうそう世話はできぬとキッパリ断ったがよい
You ought to tell him once for all that you can not go on helping him forever.
いやならいやだとキッパリ言い切ってしまうさ
If you don't like it tell him so once for all!

きっぱん〔喫飯〕
〈名〉Taking a meal:(=する) to take a meal

content:
きっぷ〔切符〕
〈名〉A ticket

content.content: 切符を改める
to examine a ticket
切符をお見せなさい
Show me your ticket―Produce your ticket.
切符を切る
to punch a ticket
切符切り
(道具)a ticket-punch―(人)―a ticket-puncher
神戸までの一等切符を下さい
Give me a first-class ticket for Kobe―Book me first-class for Kobe.
神戸行の切符を買った
I have bought a ticket for Kobe―I am booked for Kobe.
子どもの切符を二枚下さい
Give me two half-tickets for children.
切符は三日間有効
The ticket is available for three days.
片道切符
a single ticket
往復切符
a return-ticket
回数切符
a commutation ticket
五十回回数切符
a fifty-trip ticket
乗換切符
a transfer (-ticket)
割引切符
a cheap ticket
通し切符
a through ticket
定期切符
a season ticket
回遊切符
an excursion ticket―a round-trip ticket
入場切符
an admission-ticket―(停車場のは)―a platform ticket
乗船切符
a passenger ticket
無賃切符
a free pass
切符所持人
a ticket-holder
切符出札口
a ticket window―a ticket office―a booking office
切符売り
a ticket-clerk―a booking clerk
切符受取人
a ticket-collector
切符受取所
the wicket

content:
きっぽう〔吉報〕
〈名〉Good news; joyful tidings; a favourable answer

content.content: 吉報を待っている
I am waiting for a favourable answer.

content:
きづまり〔気詰り〕
〈名〉Constraint:(=する) to feel constrained

content.content: あの人は黙っているから気づまりがする
He is so silent that one feels constrained in his presence―His silence is oppressive.

content:
きつもん〔詰問〕
〈名〉Cross-examination; searching inquiry; a demand:(=する) to cross-examine (a witness); to inquire searchingly; to demand (one's reason, etc.)

content.content: 辞職の理由を詰問した
I demanded his reason for resigning.

content:
きづよい〔気強い〕
〈形〉(主観的に言えば)confident; secure; reassured:(客観的に言えば)reassuring; cheering; encouraging

content.content: 君がいっしょなら気強い
Your company will inspire me with confidence―keep me in countenance.
そうと思うと気強い
I am reassured by the thought―It is reassuring to think so.

content:
きつりつする〔屹立する〕
〈自動〉To tower; to soar

content.content: 島は太平洋に屹立する
The island towers above the Pacific.
山は雲上に屹立する
The mountain soars above the clouds.
岩は水面に屹立する
The rock rises sheer out of the water.
屹立一万尺
It soars 10,000 feet.

きてい〔旗亭〕
〈名〉
1. (=旅館)a hotel
2. (=料理屋)a restaurant

content:
きてい〔既定〕
〈形〉Fixed; established

content.content: 既定の点
a fixed point
既定の事実
an established fact
法律の既定するところ
It is established by law.

content:
きてい〔規定〕
〈名〉Prescription; ordinance; stipulation; rule; regulations; provisions:(=の) prescribed; ordained; stipulated; regular:(=する) to prescribe; to ordain; to provide for (a case); to stipulate for (some quality)

content.content: 規定に従う
to act upon the rule
規定に背く
to infringe the regulations
法律の規定
provisions of the law
こういう事件は法律の明文に規定が無い
There are no express provisions for such cases in the law―Such cases are not expressly provided for in the law.
規定通り
according to rule―in accordance with the regulations
第三条の規定によって処分す
It shall be dealt with according to the provisions of Art.Ⅲ.
規定の方法
the prescribed method
規定の賃銭はいくらか
What is the regulation fare?
規定の課程を修了する
to complete the regular course
規定の時間
the prescribed time
列車は規定の時間より十分延着
The train is ten minutes behind her time.
法律の規定するところ
It is ordained by law―prescribed by law―provided for in the law.
(納める品の)品質は規定してある
The quality is stipulated for.
物品は規定の品質でない
The goods are not of the stipulated quality.
細則は別に規定す
The by-laws are separately given.
通行規定
the rules of the road
乗車規定
the rules for passengers
職員勤務規定
the rules for regulating the duties of the staff

ぎてい〔義弟〕
〈名〉A brother-in-law; a sworn brother

ぎてい〔議定〕
〈名〉An agreement:(=する) to agree upon (a plan); to concert (a scheme, etc.)

きていえき〔規定液〕
〈名〉A normal solution

ぎていしょ〔議定書〕
〈名〉A protocol

きていめいだい〔規定命題〕
〈名〉A categorical proposition

content:
きてき〔汽笛〕
〈名〉A steam-whistle; a siren:(工場の汽笛)a hooter; a buzzer

content.content: 汽笛を鳴らす
to give a whistle
あれが就業の汽笛だ
That is the hooter for work to begin.
汽笛一声新橋を早や我が汽車は離れたり
With a whistle, we have cleared Shimbashi station.

content:
きてん〔気転〕
〈名〉Quick wit; presence of mind

content.content: 彼は気転が利く
He has ready wit―a nimble wit―He is quick-witted―ready-witted.
気転が利かぬ
He is slow-witted―dull-witted―dull of wit―slow of wit.
気転を利かす
to show one's presence of mind―take the hint
気転を利かして彼は火を消した
With presence of mind, he put out the fire.
気転を利かしてその場をはずした
I took the hint, and kept out of the way.

content:
きてん〔起点〕
〈名〉The starting-point

content.content: 上野を起点として
with Ueno as the starting-point
この線は上野を起点として青森に達する
The line starts at Ueno, and terminates at Aomori.
里数は日本橋を起点として計算してある

content:

1. (人を主格にして主観的に言えば)to like (a person or thing); to be pleased (with a person or thing―at a circumstance); to take a fancy to (a person or thing)

content.content: どうですか今度のお宅はお気に入りましたか
How do you like your new house?

ことに位置が気に入りました

たいそう気に入りました
I am very much pleased with him.
ことに時間を守るのが気に入った
I am especially pleased at his punctuality.
僕はこの庭が気に入った

content: 2. (気に入った人や物を主格にして客観的に言えば)to please (one); to suit (one); to suit one's fancy; to take one's fancy; to catch one's fancy; to find favour with (one); to find favour in one's eyes; to be in favour with (one); to be a favourite with (one); to impress (one) favourably; to prepossess (one) in his favour; to recommend himself to (one); to give (one) satisfaction; to be satisfactory to (one), acceptable to (one), agreeable to (one); to be to one's taste, to one's liking, to one's mind, to be to one's satisfaction, after one's fancy, to be after one's heart

content.content: この品はどれもお気に入りませんか
Do none of these articles suit you?
どれも気に入らない
None of them suit me―please me.
気に入った品がない
I can find no article to my taste―after my fancy.
やっと気に入った家があった
At last I have found a house to my liking―after my fancy.
彼は実に気に入った男だ
He is a man after my own heart.
今度の地位はお気に入りましたか
Is your new position to your liking?―(主観的に言えば)―Do you like your new position?
地位は好くもないが仕事が気に入った
The position is not a good one, but the work suits me―the work is to my taste.
この縁談は気に入らない
The match is not to my mind―not to my liking―(主観的に言えば)―I do not like the match.
(この本の)文章がちと気に入らない
The style is not quite to my taste.
あの男には何をさせても気に入らぬ
He can not do anything to my satisfaction.
人に物をさせて気に入らないなら自分でするがよい
If you can not have anything done to your satisfaction, you had better do it yourself.
この庭が気に入った
This garden has taken my fancy―(主観的に言えば)―I have taken a fancy to this garden.
彼は主人の気に入った
He found favour with his master―found favour in the eyes of his master―got into favour with his master.
主人の気に入っている
He is in favour with his master―a favourite with his master―in his master's good graces―in his master's good books.
たいそう主人のお気に入っている
He is in high favour with his master―a great favourite with his master.
どうして主人の気に入ったか

正直なために主人の気に入った
His honesty made him a favourite with his master―His honesty recommended him to his master.
誰でも正直にすれば主人の気に入る

あの男は正直だから気に入った
His honesty recommends him to me―He has recommended himself to me by his honesty―(主観的に言えば)―I am pleased at his honesty.
僕の気に入ったのはその方法の安全なことだ
The safety of the method recommends itself to me―(主観的に言えば)―I am pleased at the safety of the method.

あの人は(初対面で)気に入った

機敏に立まわる
to be quick―look sharp
日本人は機敏で合点が早い
The Japanese are quick of apprehension.

content:
きふ〔寄付〕
〈名〉Contribution; subscription; donation; endowment:(=する) to contribute, donate, give (something towards the funds); to subscribe (so much to a fund); to endow (a college or a hospital)

content.content: 運動会にご寄付を願います
I beg you will contribute something―give something―towards the expenses of the athletic meet.
多少にかかわらずご寄付を願います
I request you will make a contribution, however small―I wish you would give something.
彼は孤児院に一万円寄付した
He has subscribed 10,000 yen to the orphan asylum.
収益は慈善事業に寄付する
We shall donate the profits to charities.
応分の寄付を致します
I will contribute my share―give my mite―towards the object.
分に応じて寄付する
to contribute in proportion to one's means―give according to one's means―give one's mite
大学の基本金を寄付する
to endow a college
いくらご寄付下さいますか
What shall I put your name down for?―What shall I put you down for?
十円寄付しましょう
Put me down for 10 yen―I will put myself down for ten yen.
強制的に寄付をさせる(寄付金を課す)
to lay the people under contribution→『きふきん〔寄付金〕』

ぎふ〔義父〕
〈名〉A stepfather; a father-in-law; an adoptive father

content:
きふう〔気風〕
〈名〉Tone; moral tone; morale; spirit

content.content: 社会の気風を養う
to give the tone to society
国民の気風を高尚にする
to raise the tone of the people
国民の気風は国々によって違う
Each nation has its own tone.
学生の気風が好くなった
The moral tone of the student class has improved.
軍隊の気風を振るわす
to heighten the morale of the troops
日本人は尚武の気風がある
The Japanese have a military spirit.

content:
きふきん〔寄付金〕
〈名〉A contribution; a subscription; a donation

content.content: 寄付金を募集する
to collect contributions―call for contributions―appeal for contributions―raise a subscription―set a subscription on foot―open a sub-scription-book
寄付金募集
an appeal for contributions―collection of contributions
人の為に寄付金を募る
to make a purse for some one
帽子をまわして人のために寄付金を募る
to send round the hat for some one
寄付金がいくら集まったか
What do the subscriptions amount to?
寄付金が千円集まった
The contributions amount to 1,000 yen.

きふく〔帰服〕
〈名〉Submission:(=する) to submit, yield (to the Japanese, etc.)

content:
きふく〔起伏〕
〈名〉Ups and downs; undulation:(=する) to undulate; to roll; to rise and fall; to be high and low

content.content: 山岳起伏す
Mountains rise high and low.
起伏する路
a rugged path
起伏ある平原
a rolling plain
起伏多き生涯
a chequered career

content:
きぶく〔忌服〕
〈名〉Mourning

content.content: あの家では主人が死んで忌服中だ
The family are in mourning for their master.

きぶしょう〔気不精〕
〈形〉Lazy; indolent; sluggish; slothful

content:
きふじん〔貴婦人〕
〈名〉A lady; a gentlewoman

content.content: 貴婦人らしい
She is ladylike.
貴婦人のお相手役
a lady's companion
紳士が貴婦人のお相手役をする
A gentleman gallants a lady.

きふだ〔木札〕
〈名〉A wooden ticket; a wooden check

きぶつ〔器物〕
〈名〉A vessel; a utensil

きぶつ〔奇物〕
〈名〉(物)a curiosity:(人)an eccentric person; a queer fish

きぶつ〔木仏〕
〈名〉A wooden Buddha:(より)an unfeeling person

content:
ぎぶつ〔偽物〕
〈名〉A false article; a spurious article:(人の偽物)a fraud; a sham; an impostor; a humbug; a hypocrite:(売薬などの偽物)a counterfeit:(文書の偽物)a forgery

content.content: 偽物ご用心
Beware of counterfeits!
偽物を売りつける
to impose a false article upon one
偽物を売りつけられた
I had a false article foisted upon me.
あの男のことだから偽物くらいは売りつけかねまい
He is quite capable of selling you an unsound horse at a sound price.
あの人はあんなまじめな顔をしているけれども偽物だ
For all his solemn looks, he is a fraud.
その男は偽物と判明した
The man turned out to be an impostor.
この正宗は偽物と鑑定致します
I pronounce the Masamune false.
あの男は偽物らしい
He rings false.

content:
きぶり〔木振り〕
〈名〉The shape of a tree; the grace and elegance of a tree

content.content: あの松は木ぶりが好い
The pine is elegant and graceful.
盆栽は木ぶりを賞す
A dwarf-tree is prized for its grace and elegance.

きぶるし〔着古し〕
〈名〉Worn-out clothes; old clothes:(=た) worn-out, old (clothes)

content:
きふるす〔着古す〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: きぶるす〔着古す〕

content:
きぶるす〔着古す〕
〈他動〉To wear out (clothes)

content.content: この上衣はだいぶ着古してある
The coat is worn out―It has seen much service.

content:
きぶん〔奇聞〕
〈名〉(Interesting) news

content.content: 何か奇聞は無いか
Is there no news?

content:
きぶん〔気分〕
〈名〉Feeling; mood; humour; spirit; frame of mind

content.content: 今日は気分はどうかね(ご気分はいかがですか)
How do you feel―How do you find yourself―this morning?
今日は気分が好い
I feel well today.
気分が悪い
I feel unwell―feel poorly―feel indisposed.
気分がすぐれない
I feel out of sorts.
今日は仕事をしたいような気分だ
I am in the mood for working―in the humour for working.
今日は気分が悪いから勉強したくない
I am in no mood for working―in no humour for working.
全市復興気分に満ち満ちている
The whole city is full of the spirit of restoration.
あの先生が出ると教室に新しい気分がみなぎってくる
When he appears, the class is filled with a new spirit.
そういう気分の時は些細なことで腹が立つものだ
When one is in such a frame of mind, one will take offence at trifles.
これでやっと正月らしい気分になった
This makes me feel that we are in the New Year.

content:
ぎふん〔義憤〕
〈名〉Righteous indignation; just indignation

content.content: 義憤を起こす
to be filled with indignation

content:
きへい〔奇兵〕
〈名〉(Troops employed for) a surprise attack

content.content: 奇兵を放つ
to deliver a surprise attack
あの大将は奇兵を用いることが上手だ
The general is good at surprise attacks.

content:
きへい〔騎兵〕
〈名〉A cavalryman; a horseman; a trooper:(集合的に言えば)cavalry; horse (=horse-soldiers―の略)

content.content: 一万の歩兵と五千の騎兵を率いて
at the head of 10,000 foot and 5,000 horse―10,000 rifles and 5,000 sabres
騎兵の突貫
a cavalry charge
騎兵火尉
a captain of horse
騎兵中隊
a squadron of horse
騎兵小隊
a troop of horse
騎兵科
the cavalry arm
騎兵銃
a carbine
騎兵馬
a troop horse
軽騎兵
light cavalry―light horse
龍騎兵
a dragoon
槍騎兵
a lancer
驃騎兵
a hussar

content:
ぎへい〔義兵〕
〈名〉An army fighting in the cause of justice

content.content: 我々は義兵である
We fight in the cause of justice―battle for the right.
義兵を挙げる
to raise an army in the cause of justice

きへき〔奇癖〕
〈名〉An eccentricity; a whim; a kink; a mental twist

きへきか〔奇癖家〕
〈名〉An eccentric person; a whimsical man; a crank

content:
きべん〔詭弁〕
〈名〉Sophism; sophistry

content.content: 詭弁を弄す
to use sophistry―sophisticate―quibble
詭弁家
a sophist―a quibbler

content:
きぼ〔規模〕
〈名〉
1. (=仕掛け)scale

content.content: 米国はなにごとも大規模だ
Everything is on a large scale in America.
小規模の博覧会だ
It is an exhibition on a small scale.
大規模に(小規模に)事をする
to do anything in large―in little
大規模に商売をしようと思う
I am going to do business in large―do large business.

content: 2. (=設計)plan

content.content: 規模を拡張する
to enlarge the plan
規模を縮小する
to reduce the plan

content: 3. (=構造)structure

content.content: 本願寺は規模壮大なり
The Honganji is a magnificent structure.

ぎぼ〔義母〕
〈名〉A stepmother; a mother-in-law; an adoptive mother

content:
きほう〔既報〕
〈形〉Already reported

content.content: 既報の如く
as already reported

content:
きほう〔機鋒〕
〈名〉Argument

content.content: 彼は機鋒が鋭い
His arguments are incisive.
機鋒当たるべからず
His arguments are resistless.

きぼう〔企望〕
〈名〉A design:(=する) to design

きぼう〔奇謀〕
〈名〉An ingenious stratagem; a cunning artifice

content:
きぼう〔希望〕
〈名〉
1. (=期待)hope(往々複数―hopes); expectation(概して複数―expectations):(=する) to hope (for success); to expect (success); to look for (success)

content.content: この発議にご賛成あらんことを希望致します
I hope you will second my proposition.
希望を抱く
to entertain hopes (of success)
病人は全快の希望を懐いている
The invalid entertains hope of recovery―He is in hopes of recovery―He hopes he will recover.
希望を懐かせる
to hold out hopes
賞を得ようという希望をもってしたことだ
He did it in hopes of getting a reward―in the hope of getting a reward.
友人に逢う希望をもってその会に出席した
I attended the meeting in hopes of meeting some friends―in the hope that I might meet some friends.
希望を達する
to realize one's hopes
希望がかなった
My hopes are realized.
とてもかなうまいと思った希望がかなった
My wildest hopes are realized.
希望を起こす
to be inspired with hope
人の成功したのを見て成功の希望を起こした
Others' successes inspired me with hopes of success.
希望を棄てる
to relinquish one's hopes
決して希望を棄てるな
Cling to the last hope!
希望を絶つ
to dash one's hopes―blight one's hopes―blast one's hopes―extinguish one's hopes
希望が絶えた
My hopes have gone to the ground―My hopes are dashed to the ground―My hopes are blighted―My hopes are blasted―I am in despair.
結果は希望に副わぬ
The result does not come up to my expectations―The result falls short of my expectations.
結果は希望以上だ
The result exceeds my expectations―The result is beyond expectation―beyond my expectations.
これが学生に対する希望である
This is what I expect from my students.
一縷の希望も無い
There is not a ray of hope―not a gleam of hope―not a glimmer of hope.

content: 2. (=願望)wish (概して複数―wishes); desire:(=する) to wish for (peace); to desire (peace); to be desirous of (peace)

content.content: 希望を懐く
to cherish a desire
僕は洋行の希望を抱いている
I wish to go abroad―I am desirous to go abroad.
希望を達する、希望を遂げる
to realize one's wishes―attain one's desire
希望がかなった
My wishes are realized.
とてもかなうまいと思った希望がかなった
My wildest wishes are realized.
希望を述べる
to express one's wishes
銘々のご希望を述べて下さい
I wish each of you would express his wishes.
務めてご希望に応ずるように致します
I shall endeavour to comply with your wishes―meet your wishes.
ご希望通りに致します
I will do as you wish―comply with your wishes.
ご希望通りに規則を変更しました
I have altered the regulations in compliance with your wishes.
地位は希望通りの地位だ
The position is all I can desire―everything I could wish.
君のしたことは僕の希望に反する
You have acted contrary to my wishes―against my wishes.
切なる希望
one's eager wishes―ardent desire
年来の希望
one's long-cherished desire
希望者
an applicant
この地位は希望者が多い
The position has many applicants.

きぼう〔詭謀〕
〈名〉A trick; a ruse

ぎぼうし〔擬宝珠〕
〈名〉The ornamental top (of a railing-post)

きぼうほう〔喜望峰〕
〈固名〉The Cape of Good Hope

ぎぼく〔義僕〕
〈名〉A faithful servant

content:
きぼね〔気骨〕
〈名〉Care; anxiety; mental strain; a strain on the nerves

content.content: 会話を教えるのは気骨が折れる
Teaching conversation is a strain on the nerves―trying to the nerves.

きほよう〔気保養〕
〈名〉Amusement; diversion; recreation; relaxation

content:
きぼり〔木彫〕
〈名〉Wood-carving:(=の) carved in wood

content.content: 木彫の像
a wooden image

content:
きほん〔基本〕
〈名〉A foundation; a basis:(=の) fundamental

content.content: 基本単位
the fundamental unit
基本財産
permanent property

content:
きほんきん〔基本金〕
〈名〉A foundation; an endowment

content.content: 大学の基本金を寄付する
to endow a college

きほんざいさん〔基本財産〕
〈名〉Permanent property

content:
きまい〔期米〕
〈名〉Rice sold on time

content.content: 期米相場
quotation of rice sold on time

content:
きまえ〔気前〕
〈名〉Liberality; generosity

content.content: 気前の好い男だ
He is liberal (of his money)―generous (with his possessions)―free with his possessions―open-handed―free of hand.
気前を見せる
to display one's generosity
女が男の気前に惚れた
She loved him for the sake of his generosity.
彼は気前が好過ぎる
He is too generous―generous to a fault.

content:
きまかせ〔気任せ〕
〈名〉Being left to one's pleasure:(=に) at one's pleasure; at one's sweet pleasure; wherever fancy leads one

content.content: 気まかせに歩く
I go wherever fancy leads me.
彼は病身だから気まかせに勉強させておく
As he has a sickly constitution, I leave him to work at his sweet pleasure.
何事も気まかせにさしておく
I let him have everything his own way.

content:
きまぐれ〔気まぐれ〕
〈名〉Caprice; whim; whimsy:(=な) capricious; whimsical

content.content: 気まぐれな男だ
He is a capricious man―a man of moods.

content:
きまずい〔気まずい〕
〈形〉(To be) on unpleasant terms, on a disagreeable footing (with any one)

content.content: 二人の仲は気まずくなった
They are on unpleasant terms with each other.
女は旦那に気まずくなったのだ
She has lost her frank footing with her master.
金のことで気まずくなった
Money matters were the cause of the embarrassment.

content:
きまった〔極まった、決まった〕
〈形〉Regular (occupation); fixed (habitation); settled (convictions); set (forms); definite (purpose, etc.)

content.content: 彼はきまった職業が無い
He has no regular occupation.
きまった収入が無い
He has no regular income.
きまった教育を受けない
He has no regular education.
きまった住居が無い
He has no fixed habitation.
きまった目的が無い
He has no definite purpose.
きまった考えが無い
He has no settled convictions.
きまった形式が無い
There are no set forms.

content:
きまった〔極まった、決まった〕
〈形〉Regular (occupation); fixed (habitation); settled (convictions); set (forms); definite (purpose, etc.)

content.content: 彼はきまった職業が無い
He has no regular occupation.
きまった収入が無い
He has no regular income.
きまった教育を受けない
He has no regular education.
きまった住居が無い
He has no fixed habitation.
きまった目的が無い
He has no definite purpose.
きまった考えが無い
He has no settled convictions.
きまった形式が無い
There are no set forms.

content:
きまって〔極まって、決まって〕
〈副〉Always; invariably; habitually

content.content: 彼は毎日きまって散歩する
He always takes a walk every day―He makes it a rule to take a walk every day―He makes a point of taking a walk every day―He is in the habit of taking a walk every day.
彼は日曜にはきまってやって来る
He will always come of a Sunday.
結果はきまってこうだ
This is invariably the result―This is the invariable result.
彼は年首にはきまって来る
He never fails to call on me―makes a point of calling on me―on New Year's Day.

content:
きまって〔極まって、決まって〕
〈副〉Always; invariably; habitually

content.content: 彼は毎日きまって散歩する
He always takes a walk every day―He makes it a rule to take a walk every day―He makes a point of taking a walk every day―He is in the habit of taking a walk every day.
彼は日曜にはきまってやって来る
He will always come of a Sunday.
結果はきまってこうだ
This is invariably the result―This is the invariable result.
彼は年首にはきまって来る
He never fails to call on me―makes a point of calling on me―on New Year's Day.

content:
きまま〔気儘〕
〈名〉Selfishness; self-will; wilfulness; self-indulgence:(=な) selfish; wilful; self-willed; self-indulgent

content.content: 気ままをする
to indulge oneself―have one's own way
子どもに気ままをさせる
to indulge one's children―let one's children have their own way―give a boy his head
子どもには気ままをさせておきます
The children are indulged in all their wishes―allowed to have their own way.
この子は気ままで困る
He will have everything his own way.
気ままな子どもだ
It is a wilful child.
彼女は姑の手前気ままができない
She can not have her own way―She must restrain herself―out of regard for her mother-in-law.
そりゃあまり気ままというものだ
That is too selfish of you.
子どもの気ままを直す
to take the nonsense out of a boy
他の少年に接すると自然と気ままが直る
Contact with other boys will take the nonsense out of him.

content:
きまよい〔気迷い〕
〈名〉Hesitation; vacillation:(=する) to hesitate; to vacillate; to waver

content.content: どうしようかと気迷いしている
I am in doubt how to act.

content:
きまり〔極まり、決まり〕
〈名〉
1. (=取りきめ)Settlement; arrangement; agreement; understanding

content.content: きまりをつける
to settle a matter―arrange a matter
事件はまだきまりがつかない
The matter is not yet settled.
早くきまりをつけて貰いたい
I am anxious to have the matter settled.
なんとかきまりをつけなければならぬ
We must come to some settlement.
話しのきまりがついた
We have come to an understanding―arrived at an understanding.

content: 2. (=整頓)order

content.content: 新宅へ引越したばかりで家の中はまだきまりがつかない
We have only just moved into the new house, and everything is in disorder.
やっときまりがついた
Things are put in order at last.
ここへ棚を吊らないときまりがつかない
You must make a shelf here, or there is no order.
この地面を買うと地所のきまりがつく
The addition of this piece of land will round off the estate.
きまりの好い船だ
She is a trim boat.
きまりの好い体格だ
He has a compact frame.
きまりの好い人だ
He is a man of regular habits.

content: 3. (=定め)rule; regulation

content.content: 賃銭は一円がきまりです
The regulation fare is one yen.
食事前に散歩するのがあの人のおきまりだ
He makes it a rule to take a walk before meals.
時間にきまりが無い
The hours are irregular.

content: 4. (=常習)custom; habit; wont

content.content: 雇人を解雇する時は一カ月の猶像を与えて断るのが西洋のきまりだ
It is the custom in foreign countries―Foreigners make it a custom―to give their servants a month's warning.
毎日散歩するのがあの人のおきまりだ
He is in the habit of taking a walk every day―It is his wont to take a walk every day.

content: 5. (=跋)countenance

content.content: きまりが悪い
to be put out of countenance―confused―abashed―embarrassed
あまり顔を見られてきまりが悪かった
I was stared out of countenance.
ずいぶんきまりが悪かった
I was very much embarrassed.
そう尋ねられてきまりが悪かった
The question embarrassed me.
彼はきまりの悪そうなふうをしている
He is embarrassed in manner―He has an embarrassed air.
きまりの悪そうなふうをしてそうだと言った
He admitted the fact with an embarrassed air―with a bashful air.
金が足らなくってきまりが悪かった
I was confused to find that I had not enough money.
きまりが悪いからそう賞めてくれ給うな
Spare my blushes!
人中できまりの悪い思いをした
I was made to look foolish in company.
彼はどんなことがあってもきまりの悪いようなことは無い
Nothing can abash him.

content:
きまり〔極まり、決まり〕
〈名〉
1. (=取りきめ)Settlement; arrangement; agreement; understanding

content.content: きまりをつける
to settle a matter―arrange a matter
事件はまだきまりがつかない
The matter is not yet settled.
早くきまりをつけて貰いたい
I am anxious to have the matter settled.
なんとかきまりをつけなければならぬ
We must come to some settlement.
話しのきまりがついた
We have come to an understanding―arrived at an understanding.

content: 2. (=整頓)order

content.content: 新宅へ引越したばかりで家の中はまだきまりがつかない
We have only just moved into the new house, and everything is in disorder.
やっときまりがついた
Things are put in order at last.
ここへ棚を吊らないときまりがつかない
You must make a shelf here, or there is no order.
この地面を買うと地所のきまりがつく
The addition of this piece of land will round off the estate.
きまりの好い船だ
She is a trim boat.
きまりの好い体格だ
He has a compact frame.
きまりの好い人だ
He is a man of regular habits.

content: 3. (=定め)rule; regulation

content.content: 賃銭は一円がきまりです
The regulation fare is one yen.
食事前に散歩するのがあの人のおきまりだ
He makes it a rule to take a walk before meals.
時間にきまりが無い
The hours are irregular.

content: 4. (=常習)custom; habit; wont

content.content: 雇人を解雇する時は一カ月の猶像を与えて断るのが西洋のきまりだ
It is the custom in foreign countries―Foreigners make it a custom―to give their servants a month's warning.
毎日散歩するのがあの人のおきまりだ
He is in the habit of taking a walk every day―It is his wont to take a walk every day.

content: 5. (=跋)countenance

content.content: きまりが悪い
to be put out of countenance―confused―abashed―embarrassed
あまり顔を見られてきまりが悪かった
I was stared out of countenance.
ずいぶんきまりが悪かった
I was very much embarrassed.
そう尋ねられてきまりが悪かった
The question embarrassed me.
彼はきまりの悪そうなふうをしている
He is embarrassed in manner―He has an embarrassed air.
きまりの悪そうなふうをしてそうだと言った
He admitted the fact with an embarrassed air―with a bashful air.
金が足らなくってきまりが悪かった
I was confused to find that I had not enough money.
きまりが悪いからそう賞めてくれ給うな
Spare my blushes!
人中できまりの悪い思いをした
I was made to look foolish in company.
彼はどんなことがあってもきまりの悪いようなことは無い
Nothing can abash him.

content:
きまりきった〔極まり切った、決まり切った〕
〈形〉
1. (=一定の)fixed (salary); stereotyped (phrase); routine (work); beaten (path)

content.content: 彼はきまり切った収入のほかは無い
He has only a fixed income.
きまり切ったおどし文句を並べた
He arrayed the stereotyped forms of threat.
これが日々のきまり切った仕事だ
This is part of my daily routine.
きまり切った路を踏むのは面白くない
There is no romance in treading the beaten track.

content: 2. (=分かり切った)self-evident, indisputable (fact, etc.)

content.content: そりゃきまり切ったことだ
It is an indisputable fact―a self-evident truth―a truism.

content:
きまりきった〔極まり切った、決まり切った〕
〈形〉
1. (=一定の)fixed (salary); stereotyped (phrase); routine (work); beaten (path)

content.content: 彼はきまり切った収入のほかは無い
He has only a fixed income.
きまり切ったおどし文句を並べた
He arrayed the stereotyped forms of threat.
これが日々のきまり切った仕事だ
This is part of my daily routine.
きまり切った路を踏むのは面白くない
There is no romance in treading the beaten track.

content: 2. (=分かり切った)self-evident, indisputable (fact, etc.)

content.content: そりゃきまり切ったことだ
It is an indisputable fact―a self-evident truth―a truism.

content:
きまりもんく〔極まり文句、決まり文句〕
〈名〉A set phrase; a conventional phrase; a stereotyped expression; a hackneyed expression; cut and dried expressions; one's pet saying

content.content: あの人はいつもきまり文句を並べる
He always arrays cut and dried expressions.
きまり文句で言えば昔何某と言われた身だ
He has, to use a conventional phrase, “seen better days.”
「忠君愛国」はあの人のきまり文句だ
“Loyalty and patriotism” is his pet saying.

content:
きまりもんく〔極まり文句、決まり文句〕
〈名〉A set phrase; a conventional phrase; a stereotyped expression; a hackneyed expression; cut and dried expressions; one's pet saying

content.content: あの人はいつもきまり文句を並べる
He always arrays cut and dried expressions.
きまり文句で言えば昔何某と言われた身だ
He has, to use a conventional phrase, “seen better days.”
「忠君愛国」はあの人のきまり文句だ
“Loyalty and patriotism” is his pet saying.

content:
きまる〔極まる、決まる〕
〈自動〉
1. To be settled; to be arranged; to be appointed; to be set; to be decided (upon); to be fixed (upon); to be agreed upon

content.content: 事がきまった
The matter is settled―The matter has come to a settlement.
事がまだきまらぬ
The matter is not yet settled.
(君がそう言えば)それで事がきまる
That settles the matter.
日がきまったか
Has the day been fixed upon?―Has the date been set?
時と場所はまだきまらない
The time and the place are not yet appointed.
この品はまだ値段がきまらない
The price of the article is not yet fixed upon―No price has been set upon the article yet.
君の後任がきまったかね
Has your successor been fixed upon?
彼が僕の後任にきまった
He has been fixed upon as my successor.
給料の相談がまだきまらない
The terms are not yet agreed upon.
平和会議の場所はパリときまった
Paris was fixed upon as―decided upon as―the seat of the conference.
勝敗がきまった
The day is decided.
援兵が来たので勝敗がきまった
The arrival of the reinforcements decided the day.
勝敗がきまらぬ
The day is doubtful―Victory hangs in doubt―Victory hangs in the balance.
彼が後へ入ることに前もってちゃんときまっていたのだ
It was all arranged beforehand that he should succeed to the post.
人の運命はちゃんときまっているものか
Is a man's destiny irrevocably fixed in Heaven?
彼の運命はきまった
His fate is sealed―His doom is sealed.
我が国の運命はこの一戦できまる
This action decides the fate of the Empire―The fate of the Empire depends on this action.
需用によって供給がきまる
The demand determines the supply.
この点さえきまればこの問題はきまるのだ
The whole question turns upon this point―hinges upon this point.
身がきまる
to settle down
彼は女房を持って身がきまった
He has got married and settled down―settled down to a married life.
彼は様子がきまり過ぎている
He has a spruce air―a smug air.
(何々するに)きまっている
to be sure to do something―certain to do something―bound to do something
君は成功するにきまっている
You are sure to succeed―certain to succeed―bound to succeed.
彼は失敗するにきまっている
He is sure to fail―certain to fail―doomed to failure.
こちらが勝つにきまっている
We are sure to win―certain to win―bound to win.
ちゃんときまっている
It is all arranged―irrevocably fixed―a matter of course―a settled affair―an understood thing―a done thing―a foregone conclusion.
勉強家が成功し怠け者が失敗するにきまっている
It is a matter of course that a hard-working man should succeed and an idle man fail.
末は夫婦ときまっている
It is a settled affair―an understood thing―a done thing―that the two will marry in the end.
この事業の失敗に帰することは始めからきまっていたのだ
It was a foregone conclusion that the enterprise should end in a failure.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 行くかって、行くにきまってるさ
Will I go? Of course, I will―To be sure, I will.
生ある物の死ぬのはきまっている
It is in the course of nature that living things should die―Life is subject to decay.
夏は暑くて冬は寒いのはきまっている
It is natural that summer should be hot and winter cold.
医者の不養生はきまっている
Doctors are proverbially careless of their health.
彼は夕飯にはビール一本ときまっている
He always drinks a bottle of beer at supper.
どこへ行くかって、きまってら、学校へさ
Where am I going? Why, I am going to school.

content:
きまる〔極まる、決まる〕
〈自動〉
1. To be settled; to be arranged; to be appointed; to be set; to be decided (upon); to be fixed (upon); to be agreed upon

身がきまる
to settle down
彼は女房を持って身がきまった

彼は様子がきまり過ぎている
He has a spruce air―a smug air.

to be sure to do something―certain to do something―bound to do something
君は成功するにきまっている
You are sure to succeed―certain to succeed―bound to succeed.
彼は失敗するにきまっている
He is sure to fail―certain to fail―doomed to failure.

We are sure to win―certain to win―bound to win.

It is all arranged―irrevocably fixed―a matter of course―a settled affair―an understood thing―a done thing―a foregone conclusion.

It is a settled affair―an understood thing―a done thing―that the two will marry in the end.
この事業の失敗に帰することは始めからきまっていたのだ
It was a foregone conclusion that the enterprise should end in a failure.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 行くかって、行くにきまってるさ
Will I go? Of course, I will―To be sure, I will.
生ある物の死ぬのはきまっている
It is in the course of nature that living things should die―Life is subject to decay.

content:
きまんめんじょ〔期満免除〕
〈名〉Negative prescription; extinctive prescription

content.content: 債務が期満免除になる
A debt is barred by prescription.
期満免除になった債務
a prescription debt

きみ〔黄身〕
〈名〉The yolk (of an egg); the vitellus

content:
きみ〔黄味〕
〈名〉A yellowish tint; a tinge of yellow

content.content: 黄味を帯びている
It is tinged with yellow.

content:
きみ〔気味〕
〈名〉
1. (=気持)Feeling; sensation

content.content: 気味が悪い
I feel queer―feel nervous.
外国人はこの地震国へ来て気味悪がっている
Foreigners feel nervous in this land of earthquakes.
気味の悪い

(声)an unearthly voice―(出来事)―an uncanny event―(笑い声)―weird laughter of a ghost―(心地)―an eery feeling―a nervous feeling―(顔)―a ghastly face―(静粛さ)―ominous silence before a storm―(話)―a gruesome tale of murder―(病)―a horrible disease―a hideous disease
あまり静かで気味が悪い
The silence is ominous.
あまり親切にされると気味が悪い
Too much kindness arouses suspicion.
蛇は気味が悪いものだ
Snakes are horrible things.
かいこに触れるのは気味が悪い
I have a horror of touching silkworms.
こんな気味の悪いものは食われん
I can't eat such horrible stuff.
西洋人は気味悪そうに刺身を食う
Foreigners eat raw fish as if it were something horrible.
狼の遠吠えは気味の悪いものだ
The howling of wolf will make one's blood run cold.
好い気味だ
It serves you right―Serve you right!
彼は怠けたから失敗して好い気味だ
He has been idle, and richly deserves his failure.
あの人の演説を聞くと気味が好い(痛快)
It does my heart good―warms the cockles of my heart―to hear him speak.
彼が負けて気味が好い
It does my heart good to see him beaten.
かたきをとってやって気味が好い
I am revenged.
彼は敵を倒して気味好げに眺めている
He gloats over his victim.

content: 3. (=何の気)a touch (of insanity); a dash (of conceit); a spice (of humour); a smack (of satire); a flavour (of wit); a soup?on (of genius); a suspicion (of sarcasm); a shade (of anger); a tinge (of envy, etc.)

content.content: 彼は発狂の気味だ
He has a touch of insanity.
彼の文章を見ると慢心の気味がある
His writings show a dash of conceit.
あの人はこっけいの気味も無い
He has not a spice of humour―not a suspicion of humour―not a soup?on of humour―in his nature.
彼が返事をした時の声には怒りの気味があった
He replied with a shade of anger in his tone.
彼は肺病の気味だ
He has a touch of consumption.
僕は風邪の気味だ
I have a slight cold.
少々疲れ気味だ
I am slightly fatigued.
彼はやけ気味だ
He is inclined to desperation.

content:
きみ〔君〕
〈名〉
1. (=君主)a sovereign; a monarch; a ruler
2. (=主君)one's sovereign; one's lord; one's liege lord; one's master

content.content: 我が君
my lord
君に仕える
to serve one's master
君に忠を尽す
to be loyal to one's sovereign
君には忠、親には孝
Be loyal to your sovereign and dutiful to your father.
君君たらずといえども臣臣たらざるべからず
Although the lord may be unworthy of the name, yet his vassal should be faithful to him all the same.
君の馬前に死するは武士の本領
It was the duty of the samurai to die in battle for his liege lord.
君の仇を討つ
to avenge one's lord's death
君に鋒を向ける
to draw the sword against one's lord―bear arms against one's sovereign
君辱めらるれば臣死す
When his lord is humiliated, the vassal dies.

content: 〈代名詞〉You:(=の) your

content.content: 君だ
It is you―You are the man.
(菓子を食ったのは)君だろう、あやしいぜ
It looks like you. Appearances are against you.
僕が君だったらそんなことはせぬ
If I were you, I would not do such a thing.
君が僕と位置を換えたならどうするか
What would you do (if you were) in my place?
これは君だけに見せるのだ
This is for your eyes only.
この話は君だけに聞かせるのだ
The story is for your private ears.

content:
きみがよ〔君が代〕
〈名〉The national anthem of Japan

content.content: 君が代は
May thy glorious, glorious reign
千代に八千代に
Last for ages, myriad ages,
さざれ石の
Till the tiny pebbles small
巌となりて
Into mighty rocks shall grow―
苔のむすまで
Hoary moss shall overgrow them all!

content:
きみじか〔気短か〕
〈形〉
1. (=短気)short-tempered; quick-tempered; hot-tempered; bad-tempered; ill-tempered; touchy; testy

content.content: 彼は気短かで思うようにならないと腹を立てる
He loses his temper whenever anything goes wrong with him.
年をとると気短かになる
Old men are short-tempered.
気短かを起こす
to lose one's temper

content: 2. (=性急)impetuous; impatient; hasty

content.content: 彼は気短かで思い立ったことをすぐしてしまわないと承知しない
He is impetuous, and must do at once whatever he thinks of doing.
気短かを起こす
to lose one's patience

content:
きみつ〔機密〕
〈名〉A secret; secrecy:(=の) secret; confidential

content.content: 機密を守る
to keep a secret―preserve secrecy―observe secrecy
機密をもらす
to disclose a secret―divulge a secret
機密漏えい
disclosal of a secret―divulgence of a secret
政治の機密に与る
to take part in secret councils of state
機密書類
secret documents―confidential despatches
機密事務
secret business

きみつひ〔機密費〕
〈名〉A secret-service fund

content:
きみゃく〔気脈〕
〈名〉(Secret) understanding; intelligence; rapport; touch

content.content: 気脈を通ずる
to enter into understanding with―come into rapport with―keep in touch with―each other
二人は気脈を通じている
There is a secret understanding between the two―They are in rapport with each other.
彼は時世と気脈を通じている
He is in touch with the times.
教員は互いに気脈を通じて働くようにしたいものだ
The teachers should work in touch with each other.
二人は気脈を通じて互いに顔を見合わした
They exchanged a look of intelligence.
案内者は馬賊と気脈を通じていた
The guide was in league with the bandits.

content:
きみょう〔奇妙〕
〈形〉Curious; strange; singular; wonderful; queer; odd

content.content: 偶然奇妙な事実を発見した
I have lighted upon a curious fact.
彼の様子がハテ奇妙だなと思った
His appearance struck me as strange.
彼は奇妙なことをする人だ
He indulges in singular conduct.
奇妙なこともあればあるものだ
Wonders will never cease.
この薬は奇妙に利く
The medicine works wonders―dose wonders.
土人は傷にかけては奇妙だ
The natives are curious at cuts and bruises.

content:
きみわるい〔気味悪い〕
〈形〉Unearthly (voice); uncanny (event); weird (laughter of a ghost); eery (feeling); nervous (feeling); ominous (silence before a storm); gruesome (tale of murder); horrible (disease); hideous (disease, etc.)

content.content: 西洋人は気味悪そうに刺身を食う
Foreigners eat raw fish as if it were something horrible.
西洋人はこの地震国へ来て気味悪がっている
Foreigners feel nervous in this land of earthquakes.

ぎみん〔義民〕
〈名〉A philanthropist; a friend of the poor; a friend of the oppressed

content:
ぎむ〔義務〕
〈名〉
1. A duty; an obligation; a liability

content.content: 義務を尽す、義務を果たす
to do one's duty―discharge one's duty―fulfil one's obligations―meet one's obligations
国家に対して義務を尽さねばならぬ
I must do my duty to my country.
国家に対して尽すべき義務がある
I owe my duty to my country.
義務を負う
to owe a duty―lie under an obligation
兵役の義務を負う
to be under an obligation to serve in the army―liable for military service
各人国民の義務を負っている
Everybody owes the duties of citizenship to his country.
何々の義務がある
to be bound to do something―under an obligation to do something―liable for something
人は国法に従う義務がある
A man is bound to obey the laws.
借りたものは返す義務がある
One is bound to pay what one owes―under an obligation to pay what one owes.
借りたものを返すのは当然の義務
One ought to pay what one owes―It is proper that one should pay what one owes.
僕は人の借金まで返す義務は無い
I am not bound to pay another's debts―under no obligation to pay another's debts.
保証人は本人の負債を返済する義務がある
The surety is liable for the debt of the principal.
国を守るは国民の義務
It is the duty of the citizen to defend his country.
兵役は国民の義務
Military service is one of the duties of citizenship.
男子はことごとく兵役の義務がある
Every male subject is liable for military service―bound to serve in the army―under an obligation to serve in the army.
兵役義務
liability for military service
挙国兵役義務
universal liability for military service
義務兵役
compulsory military service
子を養うは親の義務
It is a parental duty to provide for one's children.
親は子を養う義務がある
A parent is bound to provide for his children.
西洋では子が親を養う義務が無い
In foreign countries, the son is not bound to provide for his aged parents―it does not lie upon the son to provide for his aged parents.
彼らを救うのは僕の義務だ
It is my duty to save them―It is incumbent upon me to save them.
己が能を発揮するのは己に対する義務
Each man owes it to himself to be true to oneself.
家名を落とさないようにするのが先祖に対する義務だ
It is due to your fathers to keep up the credit of your family.
卒業生は奉職の義務がある
The graduate is liable for public service―bound to take government service.
義務心
sense of duty
これをするのは義務を尽そうという精神だ
I act from a sense of duty.
僕は義務として働く
I work as a matter of duty.
これをしなけりゃ義務が断たぬ、義務がすまぬ
I shall fail in my duty if I neglect to do this.
義務を怠る
to neglect one's duty
義務を回避するは卑怯
It is cowardly to shirk one's duty.
義務をのがれる
to evade a duty―shirk one's duty
義務を免ずる、義務を免除する
to free one from obligations―release one from obligations―discharge one from obligations―dispense one from obligations

content: 2. (=無報酬)free labour

content.content: 義務で教授する
I teach for nothing―I am a free teacher.

content:
ぎむきょういく〔義務教育〕
〈名〉Compulsory education

content.content: 我が国の小学校は義務教育だ
Elementary education is compulsory in this country.

ぎむしゃ〔義務者〕
〈名〉An obligor

ぎむしん〔義務心〕
〈名〉Sense of duty

content:
きむずかしい〔気むずかしい〕
〈形〉Hard to please; fastidious; finical; squeamish; queasy over-nice (about anything); particular (about anything)

content.content: 彼は気むずかしい人じゃない
He is not hard to please.
彼は気むずかしい主人に仕えている
His master is hard to please―He serves a fastidious master.
彼は食物が至って気むずかしい
He is very particular about food.

content:
きむすめ〔生娘〕
〈名〉A maiden; a virgin

content.content: 生娘だから恥ずかしがる
She is a modest maiden.

ぎむてき〔義務的〕
〈形〉
1. Compulsory (education); obligatory (service, etc.)
2. (=無報酬)free (teacher); honorary (secretary, etc.)

content:
ぎむねんげん〔義務年限〕
〈名〉An obligatory term of service

content.content: 卒業生は奉職の義務年限がある
The graduate is bound to serve for a certain term.

ぎむへいえき〔義務兵役〕
〈名〉Compulsory military service

content:
きめ〔極め、決め〕
〈名〉Agreement; arrangement; a basis; a condition; terms

content.content: どんなきめでお雇い下さいますか
On what basis shall I be engaged?
ここは下宿は月ぎめだ
We board by the month here.
外国では下宿は週間ぎめだ
In foreign countries, they board by the week.
あの人は何でも独りぎめだ
He dogmatizes on everything―He is a dogmatist.→『ぎめ〔極め、決め〕』

content:
きめ〔木目〕
〈名〉
1. (=木理)grain

content.content: 木目の細かい木
Wood of fine grain―fine-grained wood.
木目の粗い大理石
marble of coarse grain―coarse-grained marble

content: 2. (=肌の木目)grain; texture

content.content: あの子はきめが細かい
She has a delicate skin―a complexion of the purest grain.
男はきめが粗い
Men have a rough skin.

content:
ぎめ〔極め、決め〕
〈接尾詞〉By (the...)

content.content: 月ぎめで新聞をとる
to take a newspaper by the month
米国では下宿は週間ぎめだ
In America, they board by the week.
ここは月ぎめで下宿する
Here we board by the month.
独りぎめ
dogmatism
君は独りぎめだ
You are dogmatic―a dogmatist.→『きめ〔極め、決め〕』

content:
きめい〔記名〕
〈名〉
1. Register; inscription:(=する) to register (a bond); to inscribe (a share)

content.content: 記名公債
registered loan bonds―inscribed loan bonds
無記名公債
unregistered loan bonds
記名株券
registered shares―inscribed shares―name-shares
無記名株券
unregistered shares―bearer shares
記名投票、無記名投票
an open vote―a secret vote―ballot

content: 2. (=署名)signature; subscription:(=する) to sign one's name; to sign (a bond); to subscribe to (a document)

content.content: 記名調印
signature and seal―hand and seal
証文に記名調印する
to sign and seal a bond
記名調印せる証文
a bond under one's hand and seal

content:
きめい〔貴命〕
〈名〉Your orders; your wishes; your word

content.content: 貴命を遵守致します
I will obey your orders―Your word shall be law to me.
貴命に従い早速上京可仕候
ln obedience to your wishes, I shall come to town without delay
貴命の通り規則を変更致しました
I have altered the rules in accordance with your wishes.

content:
ぎめい〔偽名〕
〈名〉A false name; an assumed name; an alias:(=する) to assume a false name

content.content: 彼は(何某と)偽名して敵の陣屋に入り込んだ
He found his way into the camp under a false name―under the name of A. B.
偽名して世を渡る
to sail under false colours

きめこみや〔極め込み屋、決め込み屋〕
〈名〉A dogmatist

きめこみや〔極め込み屋、決め込み屋〕
〈名〉A dogmatist

content:
きめこむ〔極め込む、決め込む〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=独断する)to take (anything) for granted; to dogmatize

content.content: 君は承諾するものときめ込んでいた
I took it for granted that you would consent.
彼は何でも独りできめ込んでいる(きめ込み屋)
He dogmatizes on everything―He is a dogmatist.

content: 2. (=何を気取る)to affect, assume, set up for, pose as (something)

content.content: 彼は紳士をきめ込んでいる
He affects the gentleman―sets up for a gentleman.
道徳家をきめ込んでいる
He sets up for a virtuous man―poses as a man of virtue―assumes a virtuous air.
どろんをきめ込む
to abscond
彼は主人の金を持ってどろんをきめ込んだ
He made off with his master's money.

content:
きめこむ〔極め込む、決め込む〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=独断する)to take (anything) for granted; to dogmatize

content.content: 君は承諾するものときめ込んでいた
I took it for granted that you would consent.
彼は何でも独りできめ込んでいる(きめ込み屋)
He dogmatizes on everything―He is a dogmatist.

content: 2. (=何を気取る)to affect, assume, set up for, pose as (something)

content.content: 彼は紳士をきめ込んでいる
He affects the gentleman―sets up for a gentleman.
道徳家をきめ込んでいる
He sets up for a virtuous man―poses as a man of virtue―assumes a virtuous air.
どろんをきめ込む
to abscond
彼は主人の金を持ってどろんをきめ込んだ

きめつける〔極めつける、決めつける〕
〈他動〉To give (one) a good scolding; to give (one) a sound rating; to give (one) a bit of one's mind; to take (one) to task (for doing wrong)

きめつける〔極めつける、決めつける〕
〈他動〉To give (one) a good scolding; to give (one) a sound rating; to give (one) a bit of one's mind; to take (one) to task (for doing wrong)

content:
きめる〔極める、決める〕
〈他動〉
1. (=決定する)to decide upon (one's career); to determine upon (a course); to fix upon (the day); to agree upon (the terms); to settle upon (one's successor); to appoint (the time and place); to set (the date); to name (the sum); to settle (a matter); to arrange (anything)

content.content: これをきめるのは君次第
It rests with you to decide―The decision rests with you.
彼を洋行させることにはきめたがどこへやるかはきめずにおいた
We have decided to send him abroad, but we have left it undecided where he shall be sent.
彼は雇うことにはほぼきめたけれども給料はまだきめない
I have very nearly decided to engage him, but the terms are not yet agreed upon.
誰を何にきめる
to decided upon one―fix upon one―settle upon one―as or for something
彼を僕の後任にきめた
I have fixed upon him as my successor―settled upon him for my successor.
会合の場所を東京ときめた
We have decided upon Tokyo as the place of meeting―fixed upon Tokyo for the place of meeting.
方針をきめる
to decide upon a course―determine upon a course
方針を換えることにきめた
I have decided to change my course―determined on a different course.
日をきめる
to fix (upon) the day―set the date―make a date
(結婚の)日をきめるのは女の役
It is for the lady to name the day.
時と場所をきめて下さい
Please appoint the time and the place.
金額を判然ときめて下さい
Please name the exact sum.
必要に応じて金額をきめる
The amount will be decided upon according to the urgency of the case―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The urgency of the case will determine the amount.
品物の値段をきめる
to fix (upon) the price of an article―sat a price upon the article
相対できめます
We shall settle the matter between ourselves.
君が後へ入ることにきめた
It is arranged that you shall succeed to the post.
債権者と話をきめた
I have arranged with my creditors.
響導が歩調をきめる
The fugleman sets the pace.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: (売買の)約束をきめる
to close a bargain―strike a bargain
目的をきめる
to set an object before one―propose an object to oneself
下宿をきめる
to take up one's lodgings―take up one's quarters
君は承諾するものときめておった
I took it for granted that you would consent.
僕は間食をせぬことにきめている
I make it a rule not to eat between meals.
彼は酒を飲まぬことにきめている
He abstains from wine on principle.

content: 2. (=決心する)to determine; to resolve; to make up one's mind

content.content: 腹をきめる、胸をきめる
to make up one's mind
腹をきめている
My mind is made up.

content: 3. (=選定する)to choose; to make a choice

content.content: どちらにきめるか
Which will you choose?―Which will you take?
いったんきめたら換えられぬ
Once you make your choice, it must be for better or for worse.
彼を僕の後任にきめた
I have chosen him for my successor.
どろんをきめる
to abscond
彼は主人の金を持ってどろんをきめた
He made off with his master's money.

content:
きも〔肝、胆〕
〈名〉
1. (=肝臓)the liver; the gall-bladder

content.content: 肝に銘ずる
to impress［stamp, engrave, imprint, inscribe］a fact on one's mind―into one's soul
その出来事は深く肝に銘じて忘れられぬ
The event is deeply impressed on my memory―indelibly stamped into my soul.
このことを肝に銘じて忘れるな
You must have this fact impressed on your mind.
肝をつぶす
to be amazed―be astounded―be petrified
皆肝をつぶして眺めておった
They looked on in amazement.
肝を冷やす
to make one's blood run cold―curdle one's blood―freeze one's blood―strike; terror to one's heart
深夜に狼の遠吠えを聞くと肝を冷やす
To hear a wolf howl at dead of night would make your blood run cold―strike terror to your heart.
肝をいる
to manage―use one's good offices

content: 2. (=肝力)pluck; courage; spirit; spunk

content.content: 肝の太い奴だ
He is a plucky fellow―a spunky fellow.
肝が小さい
He is timid―faint-hearted―a coward.

content:
きもいり〔肝煎〕
〈名〉
1. (=斡旋)management; good offices

content.content: 市長の肝いりで結婚がまとまった
The marriage was arranged by the good office of the mayor.
知事の肝いりで事が容易に運んだ
The matter proceeded easily through the management of the governor.
会は朝日新聞の肝いりで催された
The meeting was held under the auspices of the Asahi.

content: 2. (=斡旋家)a manager; a go-between; a middleman

きもだま〔肝魂〕
〈名〉Pluck; courage; spunk

content.content: 肝だまの太い奴だ
He is a plucky fellow―a spunky fellow.
肝だまが大きい、肝だまが小さい
to be magnanimous―pusillanimous
それを聞いて肝だまがひっくり返った
I was upset by the news―The news upset me.

content:
きもち〔気持〕
〈名〉
1. Feeling; sensation

content.content: 変な気持がする
I feel queer.
若くなったような気持がする
I feel young―feel myself a man.
生まれ変わったような気持がする
I feel myself another man―feel myself a new man.
気持が好い
to feel well―feel fresh―feel refreshed―feel comfortable
人を助けると気持が好い
I feel well when I have helped a man.
天気が好いと気持が好い
I feel fresh in fine weather.
湯に入って気持が好い
I feel refreshed after a bath.
新しい家へ入って気持が好い
I feel comfortable in my new house.
これは気持の好い家だ
This is a comfortable house (to live in).
気持の好い天気だ
It is pleasant weather―agreeable weather.
あの人の演説を聞くと気持が好い(痛快)
It does my heart good―warms the cockles of my heart―to hear him speak.
今日は気持が好くない
I feel out of sorts today.
気持が悪い
to feel badly―feel uncomfortable―feel sick―feel hurt
人を害すると気持が悪い
I feel badly when I have injured a man.
食った魚がふぐだと聞いて気持が悪かった
I had an unpleasant feeling when I heard that I had eaten poisonous fish.
これは気持の悪い部屋だ
This is an uncomfortable room.
気持の悪い天気だ
It is unpleasant weather―disagreeable weather―beastly weather.
誰だって賞められて悪い気持はしない
Nobody will feel displeased at being praised.
気持が悪くなる
to feel sick
血を見ると気持が悪くなる
The sight of blood makes me feel sick.
気持を悪くする
to feel hurt―be offended―take offence
彼は僕にああ言われて気持を悪くしなけりゃよいが
I hope he does not feel hurt at my remark―I hope my remark has not hurt his feelings.
僕がこんなことを言っても気持を悪くしてくれ給うな
Please don't be offended at my remark!
気持を直してくれ給え
Let us make friends!
別れるなら気持を直して別れようじゃないか
If we must part, let us, at least,part in amity.

content:
きもの〔着物〕
〈名〉(通例は複数名詞)clothes; garments:(以下は単数集合名詞)clothing; raiment; dress; apparel; garb; costume:(所有の着物)a wardrobe

content.content: 人間は着物を着る
Man wears clothing.
(朝起きて)着物を着る
to put on one's clothes―get into one's clothes―dress oneself
彼は立派な着物を着ている
He is (dressed) in fine clothes―finely dressed.
彼らは晴れの着物を着ている
They are in their best.
晴れの着物
holiday clothes―gala dress―Sunday best
汚れた着物
foul clothes
見すぼらしい着物を着ている
He is in shabby clothes―shabbily dressed.
ぼろ着物を着ている
He is in rags―clad in rags.
着て行く着物がない
I have nothing to go in.
赤い着物を着る
to become a convict
着物を着たままで寝た
I slept in my clothes.
着物を脱ぐ
to take off one's clothes―strip―strip oft one's clothes―strip oneself of one's clothes―divest oneself of one's clothes―undress oneself―(運動するためなら)―peel
人の着物をはぐ
to strip one of one's clothes
着ている着物
the clothes on one's back―the clothes one stands up in
着ている着物までもはがれた
The very clothes were taken off my back.
着物はそのままでよろしい
The clothes you stand up in will do.
着物を着替える
to change one's clothes
着物を着替えて出かけよう
I will go out in different clothes.
着物を着替えずそのままお出で
Come in the clothes you stand up in.
あの女は着物道楽だ
She is a lover of fine clothes―She is fond of finery.
子どもが大きくなって着物が小さくなる
The boy outgrows his clothes.
女が男の着物を着ている
She is dressed as a man―disguised in male attire.
あの方が着物を見て下さいます
He provides me with clothes―finds me in clothes.
人の着物を見ると人物がわかる
“The apparel proclaims the man.”
あの子は着物を持っている
She has a good wardrobe.

content:
きもん〔鬼門〕
〈名〉The north-eastern quarter; the unlucky quarter; the tabooed quarter; taboo

content.content: 家の門が鬼門に当たる
The gate faces north-east.
鬼門よけをする
to taboo the unlucky quarter
あの家は僕の鬼門だ
The house is my taboo.

content:
ぎもん〔疑問〕
〈名〉A question; a doubt:(=の) doubtful

content.content: だがそこが疑問だ
But that's the question.
彼が成功するかどうか疑問だ
I doubt if he will succeed―It is doubtful whether he will succeed or not.
疑問を挟む
to have one's doubts (about anything)
疑問詞
an interrogative
疑問文
an interrogative sentence
疑問代名詞
an interrogative pronoun
疑問点
an interrogation point―an interrogation mark

content:
キャー
〈間投詞〉

content.content: キャーと叫ぶ
to shriek―scream
キャーとひと声上げる
to give a shriek―give a scream
キャーとひと声上げて気絶した
With a shriek, she fainted away.

ぎゃーぎゃーなく〔ギャーギャー泣く〕
〈自動〉To squall

きゃーきゃーわらう〔キャーキャー笑う〕
〈自動〉To shriek with laughter; to screech with laughter

content:
きゃく〔客〕
〈名〉
1. (=来客)a guest; a visitor; a caller:(集合的に言えば一人にても数人にても)company

content.content: 親父は客がある
Father has company―Father is receiving company.
客が五人ある
He has five callers.
遠来の客
a visitor come from afar
客はていねいにあしらうものだ
You should be courteous to your guests.
あの人は客を好遇する
He is hospitable to his guests―He keeps a good house.
田舎から客が泊まりに来ている
A visitor from the country is staying with us.
田舎の伯(叔)母が客に来ている
An aunt from the country is staying with us on a visit.
客を招く
to invite guests
お客をする
to give a party
おめでたい事があってお客をするのだ
We are going to give a party on an occasion for rejoicing.
客がチラホラ帰り出す
The guests are departing by twos and threes.
魚と客は三日目には鼻につく
“Fish and guests smell at three days old.”

content: 2. (=顧客)a customer; a patron:(集合的に言えば)custom; clientele

content.content: あの店はお客が多い
The shop has many customers―The shop enjoys a large custom―a large clientele.
あの店は近頃お客が減った
That shop has lost its customers―Custom has fallen off at that shop.
あの店は安く売って客を引く
The shop draws customers by selling at low prices.
安いから客がつく
The low prices draw custom.
ふりの客
a casual guest―a stranger (at a restaurant)
ふりの客は上げません
We do not entertain strangers.
客を引く
to tout

content: 3. (=乗客)a passenger:(俥のは)a fare

content.content: 俥屋が客待ちをしている
The rickshaman is waiting for a fare―looking out for a job.
客船
a passenger boat
客車
a passenger carriage―(は英国、米国は)―a passenger car.

content:
4. 
〈その他〉

content.content: 女が客を取る
A woman prostitutes herself.
黄泉に客となる
to go to that bourne whence no traveller ever returns―go down into the shades―die
天涯の客となる
to be a stranger in a strange land
東洋の客となる
to come to live in the East

content:
きゃく〔脚〕
〈助数詞〉

content.content: 机二脚
two desks
腰掛け三脚
three benches

content:
きやく〔規約〕
〈名〉An agreement; a covenant; a contract; a compact

content.content: 会員間に規約がある
There is a covenant among the members.

content:

content: 2. (=危急)a crisis; an emergency; an exigency; danger; peril; alarm

急を報ずる
to give the alarm

急に備える
to provide against emergencies

content: 〈形〉(=な) urgent, pressing, exigent (business); sudden (departure); steep, precipitous, abrupt (mountain); rapid, swift (stream); sharp (turn); threatening, impending, imminent (danger, etc.)

content.content: あの男はいつも窮している

content: 2. (=何に苦しむ、困却する)to be at a loss (for something); to be perplexed; to be puzzled; to be reduced to extremity; to be driven to one's wits' end; to be put to one's shifts; to be put to one's trumps

content.content: 不意を打たれて返答に窮した

策に窮した
I am at the end of my resources―at the end of the tether―at my wits' end.
問題の解決に窮した
I am at a loss for a solution of the problem―perplexed how to solve the problem.
今度という今度はいよいよ窮した
I am reduced to the last extremity―driven to my wits' end―put to my shifts―put to my trumps.
人は窮するとどんな窮策でも用いる

窮すれば通ず

Call me madman, dub me rebel, little do I care!

content:
きょう〔興〕
〈名〉Zest; enjoyment; pleasure; amusement; entertainment; interest; merriment; mirth; fun

content.content: これも興がある
This is interesting―funny.
身の上話もまた一興
The story of your life must be interesting.
興を添える
to add to the enjoyment―add to the pleasure―add to the amusement―add to the entertainment―add a zest to anything
太夫のこっけいが興を添える
The performer's pleasantries add a zest to the performance.
興をそぐ
to mar one's enjoyment―spoil the pleasure―take the fun out of the thing
飛び入りを断っては興をそぐ
To exclude volunteers would take the fun out of the thing.
(露都では)敗報が来たためにお祭りの興をそいだ
The news of defeat cast a gloom on the festival.
興を尽す
to enjoy oneself
十二分に興を尽して散会す
We enjoyed ourselves to the full before we broke up.
興に入る
to enter into the spirit of the sport
(幼稚園の)先生までも興に入って遊ぶ
The teacher herself enters into the spirit of the sport―enters into it with zest.
競馬の馬が興に入って走る
The racehorse enter into the sport.
これを発見して独り興に入っていた
I chucked to myself over the discovery.
興が乗る
to warm to one's work
生徒次第で先生は興が乗る
If the students are attentive, the teacher warms to his work.
先生話に興が乗ってきた
He warmed up to his subject.
興をさます
to spoil the pleasure―spoil the fun―kill joy―cast a chill over one―break the spell
興がさめる
The spell is broken.
役者が言い損いでもすると興がさめる
A ship of the tongue on the part of the actor would break the spell.
遊楽の興をさます
to damp the ardour of pleasure
興に乗じてちと言い過ぎた
I let myself loose in a moment of mirth.
興{たけなわ}にして警報あり
When the merriment was at its height, there was an alarm.
木戸銭だけの興があった
I have had my money's worth of pleasure.

I had masses read by a priest.
あのひとの本をよむのはお経を読むようだ

門前の小僧習わぬ経を読む
“The sparrows near the school sing the primer.”

content:
きょう〔今日〕
〈名、副〉Today; this day

content.content: 今日は幾日か
What day of the month is this?―What is the day of the month?
今日は十日だ
Today is the 10th―This is the 10th.
今日は何曜か
What day of the week is this?―What is the day of the week?
今日は土曜だ
Today is Saturday―This is Saturday.
今日は休みだ
There is no school today.
今日はこれでよろしい
That'll do for today.
今日の仕事はすんだ
I have finished my day's work―(は英、米は)―I am through for today.
今日は好い仕事をした
I have done a good day's work.
今日の新聞を読んだか
Have you read todays paper?
今日中に
in the course of the day
仕事を今日中にやってしまわなければならん
I must get my work finished in the course of the day―before the day is out.
今日中に立て
You must leave before the day is out―Let not the sun set before you depart.
今日から
from this day forth
今日から禁酒する
I give up drinking from this day forth―from this day forward―from this day onward.
今日までも
to this day
事実は今日までもわからずにいる
The fact remains unknown to this day.
今日限り
this very day
お前には今日限り暇を出す
I dismiss you from my service this very day.
先月に今日、来月の今日
this day month
先週の今日、来週の今日
this day week
今日はいかなる悪日ぞ
Woe worth the day!
今日は晴れと着飾っている
They are in their best―dressed out in their best.
昨日の錦今日の襤褸
Yesterday a king, today nothing―A prince is transformed into a pauper.
今日は今日のことでたくさん
“Sufficient unto the day is the evil thereof.”
今日は今日明日は明日
“Every day brings its bread.”
今日のことを明日まで延ばすな
“Do not put off till tomorrow what can be done today.”
今日明日にも危ぶない命だ(今日か明日かという大病)
“His life hangs by a thread.”
今日明日にも知れない命だ
It is a precarious existence.
今日明日にも危ぶない地位だ
It is a precarious position.
君の来るのを今日か明日かと待っておった
I have been expecting you every day.
今日は人の身の上明日は我が身の上
Human affairs are mutable.
蜻蛉釣り
O catcher of the dragon-fly!
今日はどこまで行ったやら
How for canst thou have gone this day?

content:

〈名〉Frantic joy; wild joy; rapture; ecstasy:(=する) to be frantic with joy; to be wild with joy; to go off into raptures; to go off into ecstasies

The people were frantic with joy―wild with joy―at the news of victory.
彼は掘り出し物をして狂喜している

content:
きょうき〔狂気〕
〈名〉Madness; insanity; lunacy; frenzy:(=の) mad; insane; lunatic; frantic:(=する) to go mad; to become insane, to lose one's wits; to be bereft of reason

content.content: その熱心狂気に近し
His zeal verges on madness.
ありゃ狂気の沙汰だ
He must be mad―out of his wits―out of his mind―off his head.
人民は捷報に接して狂気せるが如く悦んだ
The people were frantic with joy at the news of victory.

Today a baseball match is held at Hibiya Park.

content:

〈名〉
1. (=評議)conference; discussion; deliberation:(=する) to confer (with some one); to discuss (a matter); to deliberate (on a matter)

content.content: 協議をこらす
to deliberate (on a matter)

The following articles were decided upon after due deliberation.

A question comes up for discussion.

The matter is under discussion.

a conference
この問題について協議会を開いている
A conference is sitting on the question.

content: 2. (=協定)arrangement; agreement

content.content: 協議が整った
We have arrived at an arrangement―come to an understanding―come to an agreement―come to terms.

content: 3. (=協賛)mutual consent

content.content: 夫婦は協議上で離婚を為すことができる
A married couple may obtain a divorce by mutual consent.

content:
ぎょうぎ〔行儀〕
〈名〉Manners; behaviour; breeding; propriety; deportment

content.content: 彼は行儀作法のある人だ
He is a man of breeding.
行儀が好い
He is well-behaved―well-bred―well-mannered―mannerly.
行儀の好い子だ
She behaves well―She behaves properly―She is well-behaved.
行儀が悪い
He is ill-behaved―ill-bred―ill-mannered.
行儀を知らぬ
He has no manners.
お前は行儀を知らんのか
Where is your manners?―Where is your hat?
それはなんという行儀だ
Where did you learn your manners?
行儀作法に注意なさい
Learn to behave―Mind your P's and Q's.
行儀好くおすわり
Sit properly!
行儀を見習う
to learn good manners
女の子は行儀を見習いに良家に奉公する
Girls take service in good families in order to learn their manners.
行儀を教える
to teach one how to behave―show one how to behave
彼は気の毒なほど行儀を崩さない
He is painfully proper.
他人行儀はお止し
Do not stand on ceremony with me.

content:

content.content: ぎょうぎ〔行儀〕

content:
きょうきゅう〔供給〕
〈名〉Supply:(=する) to supply (a man with money―money to a man); to serve (a family with commodities); to keep (a boy in pocket-money):(一回の供給なら)to furnish (one with capital―capital to one):(買って当てがうの意味なら)to provide (one with anything needful)

content.content: 伯(叔)父が学費を供給してくれます
My uncle supplies me with my school-expenses―helps me with my expenses.
東京には多摩川から用水を供給する
The Tamagawa supplies Tokyo with water―serves Tokyo with water.
本社では東京全市にガスを供給します
We serve the whole city with gas.
あの店から日用品を供給します
The house serves the family with commodities―supplies the family (with commodities).
資本を供給してやろうと言う人がある
A man offers to furnish me with capital―finance the scheme.
彼は僕に著述の材料を供給してくれた
He furnished me with the materials for my work.
明治の初年には政府が学生に書籍を供給したものだ
In the earlier years of the Meiji, the government used to provide the students with books.
ロシアでは軍隊に糧食を供給するのが困難であった
Russia found it difficult to keep the army in provisions.
絶えず仕事を供給する
I will keep you in work.
この薬品はドイツに供給を仰いでいる
We depend on Germany for (a supply of) this chemical.
この品は供給不足を告げている
There is a short supply of this article―This article is in short supply.
供給過多
an over-supply―a glut in the market
需要供給
demand and supply
相場は需要供給によって定まる
Price is regulated by demand and supply.
供給は需要に応じかねる
The supply is inadequate to the demand.
供給は需要を超過している
The supply exceeds the demand.

〈名〉A temporary abode:(=する) to take up one's temporary abode

The people are alarmed―in alarm―filled with alarm―panic-stricken.
国中物情恟々たり

content:
ぎょうぎょうしい〔仰々しい〕
〈形〉Pompous (language); bombastic, grandiose, grandiloquent, hyperbolical (style); exaggerated (way of saying things); sounding (rhetoric); high-sounding (title); consequential (manner); ostentatious (display, etc.)

content.content: あの人の言葉づかいが仰々しい
He uses pompous language.
文体が仰々しい
It is a bombastic style―a hyperbolical style―a grandiose style.
あの人の物の言い方が仰々しい
He has an exaggerated way of saying things.
仰々しく言う
to exaggerate anything―make a mountain of a mole-hill
仰々しい文言
sounding rhetoric―pompous diction
仰々しい肩書
He has a high-sounding title.
あの人の風が仰々しい
He has a pompous manner―a consequential manner.
仰々しく乗り込んだ
He came upon the town with a flourish of trumpets―with all the pomp and circumstance of war.

content.content: 胸襟をひらく
to open one's heart―unbosom oneself―to a friend

We opened our hearts to each other―We unbosomed ourselves to each other―We had a heart-to-heart talk.

content:

〈名〉
1. (=恐怖)fear; dread; terror:(=する) to fear; to dread; to be terrified
2. (=謹しみかしこむこと)awe:(=する) to be awed

content.content: 恐懼措くあたわず

content:

〈名〉A condition; a situation; a predicament; a plight; a lot; circumstances; conditions

content.content: 彼は安楽の境遇だ

僕は苦しい境遇だ

The widow is in a sad condition―in a sad predicament―in a pitiful plight―in a bad way―Hers is a sad lot.

Man is the creature of circumstances.
人は境遇を左右することができぬ

人は境遇を脱することができぬ

Happiness depends, not so much on circumstances, as on one's way of thinking.
境遇が境遇だからそんな勝手なまねはできない
Circumstanced as I am, I can not have my own way in the matter.

1. (=教え)one's teachings; a precept; an injunction:(道話などに含まっている教訓)a moral:(教訓となる事柄)a lesson

to assume a firm attitude

content:

content.content: 彼の成功は僥倖だ

I tried on the off chance of success.
天地間に僥倖などというものはあるものではない

content.content: 英語を教授する
to teach one English―give one lessons in English

He has been engaged in teaching English for years.

content:
きょうしゅくする〔恐縮する〕
〈自動〉
1. (=恐れ入る)to be filled with awe; to be overwhelmed (with gratitude or shame)

content.content: 宮中にそんなことがあっては本大臣はただ恐縮するのみです
It such a thing should happen in the Imperial Palace, I should simply be filled with awe―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Such an occurrence at court would strike me with awe.
ご主人お手ずからのお酌は恐縮です
I am overwhelmed by your condescension―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Your condescension overwhelms me.
先生に手伝って戴いては恐縮です
I should be overwhelmed by your assistance―(他動詞構文にすれば)―You would overwhelm me by your assistance.
ご案内下さるか、これは恐縮です
Will you show me the way? I am overwhelmed with gratitude―greatly obliged to you.
あんなに恐縮したことは無い
I was never so overwhelmed with shame―never more put to the blush.

content: 2. (=恥じ入る、痛み入る)to be humiliated; to be ashamed; to be put to shame; to be put to the blush; to feel small

content.content: 外国人に日本語の誤りを注意されて実に恐縮した
I was humiliated when I was set right in my Japanese by a foreigner―A foreigner set me right in Japanese, and really made me feel small.
そうお賞め下さると恐縮します
Your praises put me to shame―Spare my blushes!
そうお礼をおっしゃられてはかえって恐縮です
You put me to the blush by thanking me.
指南などは恐縮です
You put me to the blush by asking me to give you a lesson!―Give you a lesson! Why, you put me to shame.
恐縮して引き下がった
I withdrew abashed.

content: 3. (=ありがたく思う)to be grateful (to one for something); to be thankful (to one for something); to be obliged to (one)

content.content: お願いをお聴く下さるなら恐縮です
If you will grant my request, I shall be greatly obliged to you―esteem it a great favour.
誠に恐縮に御座候へども御返金の儀は来月迄御猶予被下度願上候{まことにきょうしゅくにござそうらえどもごへんきんのぎはらいげつまでごゆうよくだされたくねがいあげそうろう}
I should be greatly obliged to you―consider myself under great obligations to you―if you would wait for my payment till next month.
ご同情は実に恐縮です
I am grateful for your sympathy―thankful for your sympathy.
どうも恐縮です
I am very much obliged to you.

content: 4. (=お気の毒に思う)to be sorry; to be sorry to give (one) trouble; to regret

content.content: お勉強のお邪魔をして恐縮です
I am very sorry to disturb you in your studies.
まことに恐縮ですがこの手紙を英文に訳して下さいませんか
I am sorry to give you trouble, but will you translate this letter into English?
恐縮ですがその窓を明けて下さいませんか
May I trouble you to open the window?
恐縮ですがその本を取って下さい
I'll trouble you for that book―I'll thank you for that book.
お忙しいところをお邪魔をして恐縮です
I am sorry to intrude on your precious time.
彼は恐縮して謝罪した
He apologized with regret.
それではあまり恐縮だと存じまして
That would be giving you too much trouble.

content.content: 明治政府は人民を強制して兵役に服さしめた

He compelled me to obey―forced me to obey―forced me into obedience―coerced me into obedience―compelled obedience from me―enforced obedience on me.

I made a promise under compulsion.
強制されてした約束は無効

content.content: 人の過失を矯正する

content:
きょうそう〔競争〕
〈名〉Rivalry; competition; emulation; contest; struggle:(=する) to rival (each other in some respect); to compete (with or against each other for some prize); to emulate (each other in glorious deeds); to contest (an election); to struggle (for existence); to vie, cope (with each other in splendour, etc.)

content.content: 恋の競争
rivalry in love
商業上の競争
commercial rivalry―commercial competition
美服の競争だ
It is rivalry in dress.
武装競争
competition in arms
生存競争
a struggle for existence
生存競争をする
to struggle for existence
選挙競争
an election-contest
競争が盛んだ
There is a sharp competition―a spirited contest.
選挙の競争が激しい
The election is sharply contested.
候補者が多いから競争が激しい
The number of candidates makes the contest keen.
競争が無いから彼は独り舞台で当選した
As there were no rival candidates, he simply walked over the course―He was returned unopposed.
商人間の競争が激しい
Competition is keen―There is keen competition―among the tradesmen.
商人は競争して得意を取り合う
The tradesmen compete for custom.
支那では日本の商人は欧米の商人と競争しなければならぬ
In China, Japanese merchants must compete with European and American merchants.
日本は英国とは競争ができない
Japan can not compete against England.
日本は品では競争ができないから値段で競争するよりほか無い
We can not compete in quality, so we must compete in price.
この二人は互いに首席を競争している
They compete with each other for the first place.
学問では彼と競争できない
I can not compete with him―compete against him―in scholarship.
誰が先にするかという競争だ
It is who shall be the first to do it.
今は競争の世である
We live in an age of competition.
この競争激甚の世にうかうかしておられぬ
We can not dream our time away in this age of keen competition―in this competitive age.
自由貿易とは自由競争のことである
Free trade is free competition―competition open to all.
競争に勝つ、競争に負ける
to win in a competition―lose in a competition
競争者
a rival―a competitor―a contestant
恋の競争者
rivals in love
競争者が現れる
A competitor enters the field.
彼は競争者があると勉強する
He works hard when there is a competitor in the field.
競争心
a competitive spirit―the spirit of emulation
競争試験
a competitive examination
競争場裡
the arena of competition―the lists
競争場裡に打って出る
to enter the lists (against some one)
値下げ競争

〈名〉A religion

content:
きょうぼう〔共謀〕
〈名〉Conspiracy; collusion; confederacy; complicity (in a crime):(=する) to conspire (together―with some one); to collude (with some one); to be in league (with each other)

content.content: 彼らは共謀して財産を横領した
They conspired together to usurp the property.
彼は会計官と共謀して巨利を博した
He reaped enormous profits in collusion with the accountant.
案内者は馬賊と共謀しておった
The guide was in league with the bandits.
共謀して互いの利益を図る
to play into each other's hands
彼らは皆共謀している
They are conspirators―confederates―accomplices―in league with each other.
共謀者
a conspirator―a confederate―an accomplice in the crime―an accessory to the crime

content:
きょうぼう〔凶暴〕
〈名〉Atrocity; outrage:(=なる) atrocious; outrageous

content.content: ロシア軍とドイツ軍は支那において凶暴をたくましうした
The Russians and Germans committed atrocities in China.

〈名〉Fury; frenzy; fanaticism:(=する) furious; frantic; fanatic

Their zeal verges on fanaticism.

content:
きょうぼく〔喬木〕

content.content: 喬木風強し

“Envy strikes high.”

content:
きょうほんする〔狂奔する〕
〈自動〉
1. (=狂い廻る)to run madly about; to tear about; to tear along; to rip and tear about
2. (=しきりに奔走する)to bestir oneself; to be on the run; to be busily engaged (in doing something)

content.content: 彼は政治運動に狂奔している
He is busily engaged in political agitations.
絶えずなにかしらに狂奔している
He is continually on the run about something or other.

content.content: 鞏膜炎

content:
きょうみ〔興味〕
〈名〉Interest; zest; gusto; unction; relish

content.content: この本は興味がある
This book is interesting.
この本を読んで興味がある
I am interested in reading this book.
英語の研究は僕には興味がある
The study of English is interesting to me―I am interested in the study of English.
この学科は津々として興味が尽きぬ
The subject is full of interest.
この学科は興味が無い
The subject is devoid of interest.
あの先生の話を聞いて英文学に興味を起こした
He aroused my interest in English literature.
この本はしまいの方になると興味が薄らぐ
The book drags―The interest flags―towards the end.
太夫のこっけいが興味を添える
The humour of the performer adds a zest to the performance.
文章が悪いので話の興味をそぐ
The badness of the style takes from the interest of the story.
詩に興味の無い人がある
Some people have no interest in poetry―no relish for poetry.
彼は興味を添えてその話をする
He tells the story with much unction.
皆興味をもってその話を聴いている
Everything listens to the story with interest―with gusto.

content:
きょうめい〔共鳴〕
〈名〉
1. Resonance:(=する) to be resonant (with some sound)

content.content: 共鳴器

content: 2. (=心の共鳴)unison; sympathy; response; echo:(=する) to ring in unison; to sympathize with (one); to warm to (one); to respond to (an appeal); to echo (one's sentiments)

content.content: 二人は共鳴する仲だ
Their hearts beat in unison―They are congenial spirits.
彼と共鳴せざるを得ぬ
I can not but sympathize with him―My heart warms to him.
米国には過激派に共鳴する者がある

僕はテニスンには共鳴しない
I do not sympathize with Tennyson―My heart does not respond to Tennyson's poetry―Tennyson calls forth no response in my breast.
そう言われれば誰でも共鳴する
Such words will find an echo in every heart.

to cooperate―work shoulder to shoulder
この事業はご協力を願わなければならない
I must beg you to cooperate with me in the work―I must request your cooperation in the work.

〈名〉A defile; a gorge
